intro: Swertia chrysantha, commonly known as golden swertia, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas and parts of Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and mountain slopes. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Swertia chrysantha is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
